result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan R Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Trig's 
*Submit DNA sample 
*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
*Probation may be transferred to Wood County

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Plea/Sentencing Hearing set for 03/11/16  - return to sender, attempted - not known, unable to forward

Defendant Jonathan R Meyer in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Jonathan R Meyer in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

9:37 am. Court calls case.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Atty Constable states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Halverson.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Victim was given notification and there is no one present.
Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
60 days jail imposed and stayed
12 months probation 
Conditions:  
AODA  assessment & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Trigs  
Submit DNA sample
Participate in any other couseling deemed appropriate by the agent
Pay costs including DNA surcharge, Victim Witness surcharge & court costs
37 days jail credit in event probation is revoked
Huber privileges if approved by jail administration if probation is revoked 

Atty Constable indicates that the State does not object to probation being transfered to Wood county.

BY THE COURT:
Court indicates that the probation may be transfered to Wood County.

Prior: 1600 Briggs Street, Salvation Army, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.

State requests a $200 cash bond with conditions as stated.
